TITLE: Cornell Method
DEF: A systematic format for condensing and organizing notes
TASK: The Cornell Method pattern improves the standard note-taking process by systematizing the format for condensing and organizing notes. This approach demands students to divide their note paper into sections for cues, notes, and summaries. The pattern actively engages students with the material, helps identify key points, and fosters efficient review of information, addressing information overload and disorganization, thereby enhancing the effectiveness of note-taking.
